headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  WORTSMANN, BARBARA (NEE LEVIE)

snippet: WORTSMANN--Barbara (nee Levie), 80, of Wynnewood, PA, formerly of Queens, NY, on Monday, February 1, 2016 at Penn Hospice at Rittenhouse, Philadelphia, PA after a long illness. For many years, Barbara compassionately worked in medical offices in Manhattan. She managed physicians' offices, helped with patient care, and visited patients in the hospital during the AIDS crisis. After retiring, Barbara volunteered at the Museum of Natural History in New York, the Museum of Natural Sciences in Philadelphia, and the Philadelphia Zoo. Barbara also took art classes and was a talented water colorist, sketch artist, and maker of mosaics. She is survived by her daughter, Erica Rachlin (Mark); her sons, Joel Wortsmann, and Edward Wortsmann; her grandchildren, Jessica Wortsmann, Jaime Wortsmann, and Jonathan Rachlin. Barbara is also survived by Gilbert Wortsmann. She was preceded in death by her daughter-in-law, Judith Wortsmann. At Barbara's request, her body will be donated to the University of Pennsylvania Perelman School of Medicine. In lieu of flowers, donations in Barbara's memory to the Penn Wissahickon Hospice are welcome at www.pennmedicine.org/ homecare/services/hospice or Abramson Cancer Center at www.pennmedicine.org/ giving. 1/3
